Class Board

java.lang.Object
  Board

public class Board
extends java.lang.Object

Stores the game board as a 2D array of Squares. Also provides functionality to move the Piece of one Square to another Square, and the ability to get all possible moves of a particular Piece anywhere on the board Note: The Board is the underlying structure that is drawn to the GUI in CheckersGame.java

inBounds

public static boolean inBounds(int row,
                               int col)
Check to see if a position in this Board is in bounds

Parameters:
row - The row to be checked
col - The column to be checked
Returns:
True if in bounds, false if not

getSquare

public Square getSquare(int row,
                        int col)
Get a particular Square contained in this Board

Parameters:
row - The row at which the square should be
col - The column at which the square should be
Returns:
The square at (row, col), or null if (row, col) is out-of-bounds

public void placeStartingPieces()
Fill this Board with Red pieces on top, and Black pieces on bottom

getPossibleMoves

public java.util.Vector<Square> getPossibleMoves(Piece p)
Find all possible Squares to which this piece can move

Parameters:
p - Piece for which moves should be found
Returns:
A Vector of Squares to which this piece can move

setMovesHighlighted

public void setMovesHighlighted(Piece p,
                                boolean doHighlight)
Highlight all the possible moves that can be made

Parameters:
p - The Piece whose possible moves we are highlighting
doHighlight - Whether or not these possible moves should be highlighted

move

public boolean move(Square from,
                    Square to)
Perform a move on the board. This function does not perform input checking, as it is only called once a move has been validated by getPossibleMoves

Parameters:
from - The square from which we are moving
to - The square to which we are moving
Returns:
True if a jump has been performed, false if it's just a normal move
